title: I’m Muslim and I listen to music. How can I stop listening to music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assalamualaikum. Here are some steps , maybe they can help you :- Delete all the songs you downloaded and any apps you listen music on .Replace listening to songs with listening to Quran and Islamic poems . Here are some peaceful poems :    3. If you have any friends that listen to music tell them that you are taking a decision to stop listening to it. And ask them to respect your decision and not talk about music with you . 4. Read Quran everyday and pray your 5 times prayers and repent on your sins in front of Allah. 5. Unfollow the music artists on your social media , if you have any. 6. Stop watching TV programs that have music in them and stop watching movies that contain music . 7. Try to learn more about yourself by trying to do different things like painting , etc . Keep yourself busy. 8. It won’t be easy to follow all these steps so don’t lose hope in yourself and don’t give up . 9. Allah is all forgiving and if you really repent he will forgive you :) 10. All the very best to you . Jazakallah khair

Why don’t you want to listen to music? Do you think God requires it of you? I know it is not explicitly in the Koran. A very devout Christian young man I once knew, was told by older Christians he respected that rock and roll was evil, So he destroyed all his vinyl records. (Yes this was long ago). Several years later, he was just as devout but regretted the destruction and loss of a harmless source of joy, on the word of people who really didn’t know much about it. If you, yourself, really believe you shouldn’t be listening, then it won’t be a hardship to give up. However if you are only taking someone else’s word, you should think critically until you know what is best for you spiritually.
